intro: Turraea zambesica, commonly known as the Zambesi turraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a waxy surface, while its flowers are clustered in cyathia, a typical feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. Turraea zambesica is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
